00017 /** \defgroup binfile Binary File Access 
00018  *
00019  * \par
00020  * These functions are very usefull for reading/writing binary files 
00021  * that have headers or data that have to be converted depending on 
00022  * the current CPU byte order. It can invert 2, 4 or 8 bytes numbers to/from little/big-endian orders.
00023  * \par
00024  * It will process the data only if the file format is diferent from the current CPU.
00025  * \par
00026  * Can read from disk or memory. In case of a memory buffer, the file name must be the \ref imBinMemoryFileName structure.
00027  * \par
00028  * See \ref im_binfile.h
00029  * \ingroup util */
00030 
00031 /** \brief Binary File Structure (Private).
00032  * \ingroup binfile */
00033 typedef struct _imBinFile imBinFile;
00034 
00035 /** Opens an existant binary file for reading.
00036  * The default file byte order is the CPU byte order.
00037  * Returns NULL if failed.
00038  * \ingroup binfile */
00039 imBinFile* imBinFileOpen(const char* pFileName);
00040 
00041 /** Creates a new binary file for writing.
00042  * The default file byte order is the CPU byte order.
00043  * Returns NULL if failed.
00044  * \ingroup binfile */
00045 imBinFile* imBinFileNew(const char* pFileName);
00046 
00047 /** Closes the file.
00048  * \ingroup binfile */
00049 void imBinFileClose(imBinFile* bfile);
00050 
00051 /** Indicates that was an error on the last operation.
00052  * \ingroup binfile */
00053 int imBinFileError(imBinFile* bfile);
00054 
00055 /** Returns the file size in bytes.
00056  * \ingroup binfile */
00057 unsigned long imBinFileSize(imBinFile* bfile);
00058 
00059 /** Changes the file byte order. Returns the old one.
00060  * \ingroup binfile */
00061 int imBinFileByteOrder(imBinFile* bfile, int pByteOrder);
00062 
00063 /** Reads an array of count values with byte sizes: 1, 2, 4, or 8. And invert the byte order if necessary after read.
00064  * \ingroup binfile */
00065 unsigned long imBinFileRead(imBinFile* bfile, void* pValues, unsigned long pCount, int pSizeOf);
00066 
00067 /** Writes an array of values with sizes: 1, 2, 4, or 8. And invert the byte order if necessary before write.\n
00068  * <b>ATENTION</b>: The function will not make a temporary copy of the values to invert the byte order.\n
00069  * So after the call the values will be invalid, if the file byte order is diferent from the CPU byte order. 
00070  * \ingroup binfile */
00071 unsigned long imBinFileWrite(imBinFile* bfile, void* pValues, unsigned long pCount, int pSizeOf);
00072 
00073 /** Writes a string without the NULL terminator. The function uses sprintf to compose the string. \n
00074  * The internal buffer is fixed at 4096 bytes.
00075  * \ingroup binfile */
00076 unsigned long imBinFilePrintf(imBinFile* bfile, char *format, ...);
00077 
00078 /** Reads an integer number from the current position until found a non integer character.
00079  * Returns a non zero value if sucessfull.
00080  * \ingroup binfile */
00081 int imBinFileReadInteger(imBinFile* handle, int *value);
00082 
00083 /** Reads an floating point number from the current position until found a non number character.
00084  * Returns a non zero value if sucessfull.
00085  * \ingroup binfile */
00086 int imBinFileReadFloat(imBinFile* handle, float *value);
00087 
00088 /** Moves the file pointer from the begining of the file.\n
00089  * When writing to a file seeking can go beyond the end of the file.
00090  * \ingroup binfile */
00091 void imBinFileSeekTo(imBinFile* bfile, unsigned long pOffset);
00092 
00093 /** Moves the file pointer from current position.\n
00094  * If the offset is a negative value the pointer moves backwards.
00095  * \ingroup binfile */
00096 void imBinFileSeekOffset(imBinFile* bfile, long pOffset);
00097 
00098 /** Moves the file pointer from the end of the file.\n
00099  * The offset is usually a negative value.
00100  * \ingroup binfile */
00101 void imBinFileSeekFrom(imBinFile* bfile, long pOffset);
00102 
00103 /** Returns the current offset position.
00104  * \ingroup binfile */
00105 unsigned long imBinFileTell(imBinFile* bfile);
00106 
00107 /** Indicates that the file pointer is at the end of the file.
00108  * \ingroup binfile */
00109 int imBinFileEndOfFile(imBinFile* bfile);
00110 
00111 /** Predefined I/O Modules.
00112  * \ingroup binfile */
00113 enum imBinFileModule    
00114 {               
00115         IM_RAWFILE,   /**< System dependent file I/O Rotines. */
00116         IM_STREAM,    /**< Standard Ansi C Stream I/O Rotines. */
00117         IM_MEMFILE,   /**< Uses a memory buffer (see \ref imBinMemoryFileName). */
00118         IM_SUBFILE,   /**< It is a sub file. FileName is a imBinFile* pointer from any other module. */
00119   IM_FILEHANDLE,/**< System dependent file I/O Rotines, but FileName is a system file handle ("int" in UNIX and "HANDLE" in Windows). */
00120         IM_IOCUSTOM0  /**< Other registered modules starts from here. */
00121 };
00122 
00123 /** Sets the current I/O module.
00124  * \returns the previous function set, or -1 if failed.
00125  * See also \ref imBinFileModule.
00126  * \ingroup binfile */
00127 int imBinFileSetCurrentModule(int pModule);
00128 
00129 /** \brief Memory File Filename Parameter Structure
00130  *
00131  * \par
00132  *  Fake file name for the memory I/O module.
00133  * \ingroup binfile */
00134 typedef struct _imBinMemoryFileName
00135 {
00136   unsigned char *buffer; /**< The memory buffer. If you are reading the buffer must exists. 
00137                           *   If you are writing the buffer can be internally allocated to the given size. The buffer is never free.
00138                           *   The buffer is allocated using "malloc", and reallocated using "realloc". Use "free" to release it. 
00139                           *   To avoid RTL conflicts use the function imBinMemoryRelease. */
00140   int size;              /**< Size of the buffer. */ 
00141   float reallocate;      /**< Reallocate factor for the memory buffer when writing (size += reallocate*size). 
00142                           *   Set reallocate to 0 to disable reallocation, in this case buffer must not be NULL. */
00143 }imBinMemoryFileName;
00144                                              
00145 /** Release the internal memory allocated when writing a Memory File (see \ref imBinMemoryFileName).
00146  * \ingroup binfile */
00147 void imBinMemoryRelease(unsigned char *buffer);
00148 
00149 
00150 #if     defined(__cplusplus)
00151 }
00152 #endif
00153 
00154 
00155 #if     defined(__cplusplus)
00156 
00157 /** \brief Binary File I/O Base Class
00158  *
00159  * Base class to help the creation of new modules.\n
00160  * It handles the read/write operations with byte order correction if necessary.
00161  * \ingroup binfile */
00162 class imBinFileBase
00163 {
00164   friend class imBinSubFile;
00165 
00166 protected:
00167   int IsNew,
00168       FileByteOrder,
00169       DoByteOrder;   // to speed up byte order checking
00170 
00171   // These will actually read/write the data
00172   virtual unsigned long ReadBuf(void* pValues, unsigned long pSize) = 0;
00173   virtual unsigned long WriteBuf(void* pValues, unsigned long pSize) = 0;
00174 
00175   void SetByteOrder(int ByteOrder)
00176   {
00177     this->FileByteOrder = ByteOrder;
00178     
00179           if (ByteOrder != imBinCPUByteOrder())
00180             this->DoByteOrder = 1;
00181           else
00182       this->DoByteOrder = 0;
00183   }
00184 
00185 public:
00186 
00187   int InitByteOrder(int ByteOrder)
00188   {
00189     int old_byte_order = this->FileByteOrder;
00190     SetByteOrder(ByteOrder);
00191     return old_byte_order;
00192   }
00193 
00194   // These will take care of byte swap if needed.
00195 
00196   unsigned long Read(void* pValues, unsigned long pCount, int pSizeOf)
00197   {
00198     unsigned long rSize = ReadBuf(pValues, pCount * pSizeOf);
00199     if (pSizeOf != 1 && DoByteOrder) imBinSwapBytes(pValues, pCount, pSizeOf);
00200     return rSize/pSizeOf;
00201   }
00202 
00203   unsigned long Write(void* pValues, unsigned long pCount, int pSizeOf)
00204   {
00205     if (pSizeOf != 1 && DoByteOrder) imBinSwapBytes(pValues, pCount, pSizeOf);
00206     return WriteBuf(pValues, pCount * pSizeOf)/pSizeOf;
00207   }
00208 
00209   virtual void Open(const char* pFileName) = 0;
00210   virtual void New(const char* pFileName) = 0;
00211   virtual void Close() = 0;
00212   virtual unsigned long FileSize() = 0;
00213   virtual int HasError() const = 0;
00214   virtual void SeekTo(unsigned long pOffset) = 0;
00215   virtual void SeekOffset(long pOffset) = 0;
00216   virtual void SeekFrom(long pOffset) = 0;
00217   virtual unsigned long Tell() const = 0;
00218   virtual int EndOfFile() const = 0;
00219 };
00220 
00221 /** File I/O module creation callback.
00222  * \ingroup binfile */
00223 typedef imBinFileBase* (*imBinFileNewFunc)();
00224 
00225 /** Register a user I/O module.\n
00226  * Returns the new function set id.\n
00227  * Accepts up to 10 modules.
00228  * \ingroup binfile */
00229 extern "C" int imBinFileRegisterModule(imBinFileNewFunc pNewFunc);
00230 
00231 #endif

00233 #endif
